Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Pitcher
Description: Carinated pear-shaped pitcher (stocky in its lower part) with a tall ring base, a high wide neck with flaring walls and a double-beaded lip (c-a-d, followed by two salient projections) with a flat extremity. There is a small, pinched spout on the orifice and a handle that connects the upper part of the neck with the shoulder.
